intro: Hackelia setosa, commonly known as the slender fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has opposite, slender leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hackelia setosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
